thread.title: Chinese stocks slump on local data
thread.title_full: Chinese stocks slump on local data | Business Spectator

author: AFP
title: Chinese stocks slump on local data
text:
Shares in Shanghai have broken a five-session winning streak after data showing Chinese inflation eased in September compounded fears about the world's second-largest economy.
The benchmark Shanghai Composite Index on Wednesday lost 0.93 per cent, or 30.79 points, to 3,262.44 and the Shenzhen Composite Index, which tracks stocks on China's second exchange, fell 1.20 per cent, or 22.96 points, to 1,884.16.
And in Hong Kong, the Hang Seng Index ended 0.71 per cent, or 160.55 points, down at 22,439.91.
